title: National Archives release 2005 cabinet documents | ABC NEWS
description: As the Albanese government grapples with the aftermath of the Bondi terror attack, previously secret cabinet papers reveal the Howard government also face concerns around extremism and social cohesion.   Twenty years on, hundreds of documents from 2005 have been released into the public domain and can bow be accessed in the national archives.   Video by Romy Stephens, ABC Politics. title: How did Australia prepare for Y2K and the Millennium bug? | ABC NEWS
description: The millennium or Y2K bug was a predicted catastrophic malfunction in computers everywhere, as the date ticked over at midnight from 31/12/99 to 01/01/00. This was caused by a programming shortcut, in which only two digits were used to represent the year instead of four, meaning the year 2000 could be interpreted as 1900 â€“ potentially causing widespread failures of computer systems.   Businesses and governments spent billions of dollars updating computers and systems to prepare for the event, to try to prevent chaos and loss of life resulting from the failure of telephone networks, public transport systems, hospitals, banks and government databases.   Original reporting by Sarah Clarke. Social version produced by Madeleine Wales for ABC News Digital.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: How will Israel's ban on certain aid organisations affect Gaza? | ABC NEWS
description: Israel is banning dozens of major aid organisations from working in Gaza, saying they failed to meet new registration requirements. The agencies claim the bans will have a "catastrophic" impact on the population of the strip.  The Israeli government argues the charities are being refused accreditation because they won't hand over details of their local staff. title: China's beef import restrictions set to affect Australia's industry | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 China has announced a new 55% quota on beef once import quotas are exceeded. title: Unsealed documents shed light on NT's turbulent 90â€™s | ABC NEWS
description: Meanwhile in the Northern Territory, a trove of cabinet documents from 30 years ago reveal confidential government discussions around the purchase of poker machines and amendments to landmark euthanasia laws.   In 1995, then Chief Minister Marshall Perron resigned from politics, making way for a CLP government led by Shane Stone, which sought to bolster its coffers with gambling revenue. Oliver Chaseling has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Swiss officials confirm dozens killed in ski resort fire | ABC NEWS
description: Dozens of people have died after an explosion and fire at a crowded bar in Crans-Montana in Switzerland, authorities have confirmed. Around 100 more are injured, many seriously, and multiple hospitals are treating victims. Authorities are not treating the incident as an attack. title: Dozens killed and more injured in Swiss ski resort fire | ABC NEWS
description: Police in Switzerland say dozens of people have been killed and at least 100 injured after a fire broke out inside a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations. The blaze at the Crans-Montana resort started at around 1:30AM local time. Authorities are treating the incident as a fire and not an attack. A major emergency response is underway, with local media reporting hospitals are overwhelmed with burn victims. Elias Clure spoke to Manny Tsigas about the latest from the scene.
